com.mirth.connect.connectors.fhir.server.userutil

Class FhirResponseFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mirth.connect.connectors.fhir.server.userutil.FhirResponseFactory

  • public class FhirResponseFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class that provides methods to create FhirResponse objects.

    • Method Detail

      • getReadResponse

        public static FhirResponse getReadResponse(java.lang.String message,
                                           java.lang.String vid,
                                           java.util.Date lastModified,
                                           int statusCode,
                                           java.lang.String mimeType)
        Creates a FhirResponse for use with a FHIR read interaction.

        Status Codes:
        • 200 OK: Resource was retrieved successfully.
        • 404 Not Found: Resource is unknown.
        • 410 Gone: Resource was deleted.

        See also: FHIR DSTU2 2.1.0.8
        Parameters:
        message - The response payload.
        vid - The version ID of the resource.
        lastModified - The last modified date of the resource.
        statusCode - The HTTP status code to send back to the client.
        mimeType - The MIME type to send back to the client.
        Returns:
        The FhirResponse object.

      • getVreadResponse

        public static FhirResponse getVreadResponse(java.lang.String message,
                                            java.util.Date lastModified,
                                            int statusCode,
                                            java.lang.String mimeType)
        Creates a FhirResponse for use with a FHIR vread interaction.

        Status Codes:
        • 200 OK: Resource was retrieved successfully.
        • 404 Not Found: Resource is unknown, or accessing previous versions is not supported.
        • 410 Gone: The version referred to is one where the resource was deleted.

        See also: FHIR DSTU2 2.1.0.9
        Parameters:
        message - The response payload.
        lastModified - The last modified date of the resource.
        statusCode - The HTTP status code to send back to the client.
        mimeType - The MIME type to send back to the client.
        Returns:
        The FhirResponse object.

      • getUpdateResponse

        public static FhirResponse getUpdateResponse(java.lang.String vid,
                                             java.util.Date lastModified,
                                             int statusCode)
        Creates a FhirResponse for use with a FHIR update interaction. This update response does not include a resource payload.

        Status Codes:
        • 200 OK: Resource was updated successfully.
        • 201 Created: Resource was created successfully.
        • 400 Bad Request: The resource ID does not match the request URI, the resource is invalid, or multiple matches were found.
        • 404 Not Found: Resource type not supported.
        • 405 Method Not Allowed: The resource did not exist prior to the update, and the server does not allow client-defined IDs.
        • 409 Conflict: If-Match header does not match the version ID.
        • 412 Precondition Failed: If-Match header is required by the server and was not found in the request.
        • 422 Unprocessable Entity: The proposed resource violated applicable FHIR profiles or server business rules.

        See also: FHIR DSTU2 2.1.0.10
        Parameters:
        vid - The version ID of the resource.
        lastModified - The last modified date of the resource.
        statusCode - The HTTP status code to send back to the client.
        Returns:
        The FhirResponse object.

      • getUpdateResponse

        public static FhirResponse getUpdateResponse(java.lang.String message,
                                             java.lang.String vid,
                                             java.util.Date lastModified,
                                             int statusCode,
                                             java.lang.String mimeType)
        Creates a FhirResponse for use with a FHIR update interaction. This update response includes a resource payload.

        Status Codes:
        • 200 OK: Resource was updated successfully.
        • 201 Created: Resource was created successfully.
        • 400 Bad Request: The resource ID does not match the request URI, the resource is invalid, or multiple matches were found.
        • 404 Not Found: Resource type not supported.
        • 405 Method Not Allowed: The resource did not exist prior to the update, and the server does not allow client-defined IDs.
        • 409 Conflict: If-Match header does not match the version ID.
        • 412 Precondition Failed: If-Match header is required by the server and was not found in the request.
        • 422 Unprocessable Entity: The proposed resource violated applicable FHIR profiles or server business rules.

        See also: FHIR DSTU2 2.1.0.10
        Parameters:
        message - The response payload.
        vid - The version ID of the resource.
        lastModified - The last modified date of the resource.
        statusCode - The HTTP status code to send back to the client.
        mimeType - The MIME type to send back to the client.
        Returns:
        The FhirResponse object.

      • getDeleteResponse

        public static FhirResponse getDeleteResponse(java.lang.String vid,
                                             java.util.Date lastModified,
                                             int statusCode)
        Creates a FhirResponse for use with a FHIR delete interaction. This delete response does not include an operation outcome payload.

        Status Codes:
        • 200 OK: The resource did not exist (in the case of a non-conditional delete).
        • 204 No Content: The resource was successfully deleted, or the resource did not exist (in the case of a non-conditional delete).
        • 404 Not Found: No matches were found for a conditional delete.
        • 405 Method Not Allowed: The server refuses to delete resources of the given type.
        • 409 Conflict: The server refuses the delete because of resource-specific reasons such as referential integrity.
        • 412 Precondition Failed: Multiple matches were found for a conditional delete, and the server does not support deleting multiple resources.

        See also: FHIR DSTU2 2.1.0.12
        Parameters:
        vid - The version ID of the resource.
        lastModified - The last modified date of the resource.
        statusCode - The HTTP status code to send back to the client.
        Returns:
        The FhirResponse object.

      • getDeleteResponse

        public static FhirResponse getDeleteResponse(java.lang.String message,
                                             java.lang.String id,
                                             java.lang.String vid,
                                             java.util.Date lastModified,
                                             int statusCode,
                                             java.lang.String mimeType)
        Creates a FhirResponse for use with a FHIR delete interaction. This delete response includes an operation outcome payload.

        Status Codes:
        • 200 OK: The resource did not exist (in the case of a non-conditional delete).
        • 204 No Content: The resource was successfully deleted, or the resource did not exist (in the case of a non-conditional delete).
        • 404 Not Found: No matches were found for a conditional delete.
        • 405 Method Not Allowed: The server refuses to delete resources of the given type.
        • 409 Conflict: The server refuses the delete because of resource-specific reasons such as referential integrity.
        • 412 Precondition Failed: Multiple matches were found for a conditional delete, and the server does not support deleting multiple resources.

        See also: FHIR DSTU2 2.1.0.12
        Parameters:
        message - The response payload.
        id - The logical ID of the resource.
        vid - The version ID of the resource.
        lastModified - The last modified date of the resource.
        statusCode - The HTTP status code to send back to the client.
        mimeType - The MIME type to send back to the client.
        Returns:
        The FhirResponse object.

      • getCreateResponse

        public static FhirResponse getCreateResponse(java.lang.String id,
                                             java.lang.String vid,
                                             java.util.Date lastModified,
                                             int statusCode)
        Creates a FhirResponse for use with a FHIR create interaction. This update response does not include a resource payload.

        Status Codes:
        • 201 Created: Resource was created successfully.
        • 400 Bad Request: An ID was provided (client should use update instead), the resource could not be parsed, or failed basic FHIR validation rules.
        • 404 Not Found: Resource type not supported, or not a FHIR end-point.
        • 405 Method Not Allowed: The server does not support creating resources.
        • 422 Unprocessable Entity: The proposed resource violated applicable FHIR profiles or server business rules.

        See also: FHIR DSTU2 2.1.0.13
        Parameters:
        id - The logical ID of the resource.
        vid - The version ID of the resource.
        lastModified - The last modified date of the resource.
        statusCode - The HTTP status code to send back to the client.
        Returns:
        The FhirResponse object.

      • getCreateResponse

        public static FhirResponse getCreateResponse(java.lang.String message,
                                             java.lang.String id,
                                             java.lang.String vid,
                                             java.util.Date lastModified,
                                             int statusCode,
                                             java.lang.String mimeType)
        Creates a FhirResponse for use with a FHIR create interaction. This update response includes a resource payload.

        Status Codes:
        • 201 Created: Resource was created successfully.
        • 400 Bad Request: An ID was provided (client should use update instead), the resource could not be parsed, or failed basic FHIR validation rules.
        • 404 Not Found: Resource type not supported, or not a FHIR end-point.
        • 405 Method Not Allowed: The server does not support creating resources.
        • 422 Unprocessable Entity: The proposed resource violated applicable FHIR profiles or server business rules.

        See also: FHIR DSTU2 2.1.0.13
        Parameters:
        message - The response payload.
        id - The logical ID of the resource.
        vid - The version ID of the resource.
        lastModified - The last modified date of the resource.
        statusCode - The HTTP status code to send back to the client.
        mimeType - The MIME type to send back to the client.
        Returns:
        The FhirResponse object.

      • getSearchResponse

        public static FhirResponse getSearchResponse(java.lang.String message,
                                             int statusCode,
                                             java.lang.String mimeType)
        Creates a FhirResponse for use with a FHIR search interaction.

        Status Codes:
        • 200 OK: Bundle was successfully retrieved.
        • 403 Forbidden: The server refuses search interactions.

        See also: FHIR DSTU2 2.1.0.14
        Parameters:
        message - The response payload.
        statusCode - The HTTP status code to send back to the client.
        mimeType - The MIME type to send back to the client.
        Returns:
        The FhirResponse object.

      • getSearchAllResponse

        public static FhirResponse getSearchAllResponse(java.lang.String message,
                                                int statusCode,
                                                java.lang.String mimeType)
        Creates a FhirResponse for use with a FHIR search-all interaction.

        Status Codes:
        • 200 OK: Bundle was successfully retrieved.
        • 403 Forbidden: The server refuses search interactions.

        See also: FHIR DSTU2 2.1.0.14.1
        Parameters:
        message - The response payload.
        statusCode - The HTTP status code to send back to the client.
        mimeType - The MIME type to send back to the client.
        Returns:
        The FhirResponse object.

      • getTransactionResponse

        public static FhirResponse getTransactionResponse(java.lang.String message,
                                                  int statusCode,
                                                  java.lang.String mimeType)
        Creates a FhirResponse for use with a FHIR transaction (batch) interaction.

        Status Codes:
        • 200 OK: All actions in the bundle were accepted.
        • 400 Bad Request: One or more actions in the bundle were not accepted.
        • 404 Not Found: No matches were found for a conditional delete.
        • 405 Method Not Allowed: The server refused one or more of the interactions in the bundle.
        • 409 Conflict: One or more of the interactions in the bundle failed due to a conflict.
        • 412 Precondition Failed: One or more of the interactions in the bundle failed due to an If-Match header not being present.
        • 422 Unprocessable Entity: One or more of the resources in the bundle violated applicable FHIR profiles or server business rules.

        See also: FHIR DSTU2 2.1.0.16
        Parameters:
        message - The response payload.
        statusCode - The HTTP status code to send back to the client.
        mimeType - The MIME type to send back to the client.
        Returns:
        The FhirResponse object.

      • getHistoryResponse

        public static FhirResponse getHistoryResponse(java.lang.String message,
                                              int statusCode,
                                              java.lang.String mimeType)
        Creates a FhirResponse for use with a FHIR history, history-type, or history-all interaction.

        Status Codes:
        • 200 OK: History bundle of resource(s) successfully retrieved.


        See also: FHIR DSTU2 2.1.0.17
        Parameters:
        message - The response payload.
        statusCode - The HTTP status code to send back to the client.
        mimeType - The MIME type to send back to the client.
        Returns:
        The FhirResponse object.
